Dear Cherry and Sudheesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

Could you kindly confirm whether the issue with the pipes has been fully rectified and if the replacements have already been completed?

 

Additionally, I would like to formally raise a concern regarding the painted pillar. The colour used is entirely different from the original, which is unacceptable. Moreover, as shown in the attached image, there are visible marks on the wall, and mold is still present at the bottom portion of the wall near the floor.

Dear Cherry and Sudheesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

Could you kindly confirm whether the issue with the pipes has been fully rectified and if the replacements have already been completed?

 

Additionally, I would like to formally raise a concern regarding the painted pillar. The colour used is entirely different from the original, which is unacceptable. Moreover, as shown in the attached image, there are visible marks on the wall, and mold is still present at the bottom portion of the wall near the floor.

The affected area was painted by the mall FM team using a standard RAL color, while the original stucco finish is customized. This mismatch now requires us to cut and replace the entire painted wall to match the existing finish.

 

Kindly inform the mall FM team not to carry out any such work inside the store—unless it is high priority—without prior approval from me or the brand. This will help avoid similar inconveniences in the future.

 

 

Best Regards

Your prompt attention and confirmation on next steps would be greatly appreciated.

 

Many Thanks

Dear Sreeraj, Hagop, 

We have to proceed with fixing it asap.
The initial issue arose due to the faulty AC, which is under the mall’s responsibility. The mall also sent their own team to address it. However, as you can see, the way the wall has been “fixed” is not acceptable and now requires major corrective work.
We want to ensure that our business is not charged for these repairs, as the cause and the inadequate fix were both on the mall’s side. The cost should therefore be covered either by the mall directly or through their insurance.
BR
Iza

I am writing to seek your support regarding the unresolved Ferragamo issue that has been pending since June without a permanent rectification. As you are aware, the problem originated due to AC leakage or pipe rain leakage, for which the mall’s maintenance team visited the store. However, the manner in which the wall was “fixed” is not acceptable, and the condition now requires major corrective work.

 

Given that the issue arose from a leakage attributable to the mall’s facilities, our business should not bear the cost of rectification. Accordingly, we request that this matter be processed under the mall’s insurance coverage. We kindly ask you to provide us with the official mall report at the earliest so that we may proceed with the insurance claim, avoid further delays, and ensure the necessary corrective works can be carried out to resolve this matter.

 

We appreciate your prompt attention and cooperation.

 

Best regards,

 

KAWTTAR NASSIK

chunks.text:
I am writing to seek your support regarding the unresolved Ferragamo issue that has been pending since June without a permanent rectification. As you are aware, the problem originated due to AC leakage or pipe rain leakage, for which the mall’s maintenance team visited the store. However, the manner in which the wall was “fixed” is not acceptable, and the condition now requires major corrective work.

 

Given that the issue arose from a leakage attributable to the mall’s facilities, our business should not bear the cost of rectification. Accordingly, we request that this matter be processed under the mall’s insurance coverage. We kindly ask you to provide us with the official mall report at the earliest so that we may proceed with the insurance claim, avoid further delays, and ensure the necessary corrective works can be carried out to resolve this matter.

 

We appreciate your prompt attention and cooperation.

 

Best regards,

 

KAWTTAR NASSIK

​​​​

SENIOR ASSOCIATE ‑ RSO

ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

‑

Subject: Re: Urgent Request for Access – BOWLER & FERREGAMO- Water Leakage
--------------------------------------------------
Dear Izabela,

 

From my side, I can confirm that our property insurance does cover water damages.

 

However, please note that a USD 2,000 deductible applies per occurrence under the policy. As such, we cannot guarantee the business will not be charged, at least for the deductible portion.

 

For the sake of good order, I have already opened a claim file. That said, I suggest we wait for the Dubai Mall’s response first in case this can be resolved internally.

 

If there is time pressure to rectify the damages due to the brand visit, I can request the insurer to appoint a surveyor to perform a site visit at a convenient time.

 

For now, the claim is noted and the insurance team is on standby should you wish to proceed.

 

Please provide a store contact name and mobile number for the person who can accompany the surveyor during the site should you wish to proceed further.

 

Best regards,

Hagop

Dear Cherry and Sudheesh,

 

I hope this message finds you well.

 

Could you kindly confirm whether the issue with the pipes has been fully rectified and if the replacements have already been completed?

 

Additionally, I would like to formally raise a concern regarding the painted pillar. The colour used is entirely different from the original, which is unacceptable. Moreover, as shown in the attached image, there are visible marks on the wall, and mold is still present at the bottom portion of the wall near the floor.

The affected area was painted by the mall FM team using a standard RAL color, while the original stucco finish is customized. This mismatch now requires us to cut and replace the entire painted wall to match the existing finish.

 

Kindly inform the mall FM team not to carry out any such work inside the store—unless it is high priority—without prior approval from me or the brand. This will help avoid similar inconveniences in the future.

 

 

Best Regards

I am writing to seek your support regarding the unresolved Ferragamo issue that has been pending since June without a permanent rectification. As you are aware, the problem originated due to AC leakage or pipe rain leakage, for which the mall’s maintenance team visited the store. However, the manner in which the wall was “fixed” is not acceptable, and the condition now requires major corrective work.

 

Given that the issue arose from a leakage attributable to the mall’s facilities, our business should not bear the cost of rectification. Accordingly, we request that this matter be processed under the mall’s insurance coverage. We kindly ask you to provide us with the official mall report at the earliest so that we may proceed with the insurance claim, avoid further delays, and ensure the necessary corrective works can be carried out to resolve this matter.

 

We appreciate your prompt attention and cooperation.

 

Best regards,

 

KAWTTAR NASSIK

​​​​

SENIOR ASSOCIATE ‑ RSO

ALLIED ENTERPRISES LLC

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

Dear Izabela,

 

From my side, I can confirm that our property insurance does cover water damages.

 

However, please note that a USD 2,000 deductible applies per occurrence under the policy. As such, we cannot guarantee the business will not be charged, at least for the deductible portion.

 

For the sake of good order, I have already opened a claim file. That said, I suggest we wait for the Dubai Mall’s response first in case this can be resolved internally.

I am following up to kindly request an update on the matter outlined below. We are potentially expecting a brand visit towards the end of September, and it is essential that the wall is repaired and restored to ensure it matches the rest of the store’s colour scheme.

 

It is important that this work is completed ahead of the visit, as we cannot present the store in its current state to the brand team.

 

Your prompt attention and confirmation on next steps would be greatly appreciated.

 

Many Thanks

 

 

GEORGE LAWN

However, the manner in which the wall was “fixed” is not acceptable, and the condition now requires major corrective work.

 

Given that the issue arose from a leakage attributable to the mall’s facilities, our business should not bear the cost of rectification. Accordingly, we request that this matter be processed under the mall’s insurance coverage. We kindly ask you to provide us with the official mall report at the earliest so that we may proceed with the insurance claim, avoid further delays, and ensure the necessary corrective works can be carried out to resolve this matter.

 

We appreciate your prompt attention and cooperation.

 

Best regards,

 

KAWTTAR NASSIK
